page.title: 14SPORT AND RECREATION
page.content: Pakefield Beach is a favourite spot for {anglers} from all over the British Isles. National competitions are held there. At G.R. 535 908 is a large open space called Walmer Recreation Ground. This is used by local {sports} clubs throughout the year for cricket, hockey and football. Close by at G.R. 534 908 is the headquarters of the Lowestoft Athletics Club with facilities for field and track events. Until 1979 this land formed part of the Lowestoft Golf Course. At G.R. 535 904 there is a small children's play area with swings, see-saw and goal post. At G.R. 532 902 are the playing fields for the two schools. The {beach} is used by holiday- makers in the summer and a well-used public {footpath} extends from Pakefield Church along the cliff in a southerly direction.
